Admittedly, company protocols were not followed here by the individual who handles the life insurance applicants. Company leadership was able to isolate and address this matter within moments of your review. It pains us deeply that we have failed in our mission with you. We will continue to reach out to you by telephone to express our deepest apologies.

name: Etta Lea
text: I switched my auto and homeowners over to Lokey a couple of weeks ago. Even though they didn't honor the pricing in their marketing solicitation (hello, bait & switch), I still signed up as I liked the idea of working with a locally-owned agent. After I had cancelled my policies with Geico & Liberty Mutual, I was notified by mail that the Allstate homeowners policy written by Lokey was cancelled. I called Dakota at Lokey in a panic, he indicated that I still had a few days before the cancellation would take effect. He said he would look into the issue and call me back. He never called me back, I had to call him a few days later.  Once again he said he would call me back, but I had to call him back again. He then informed me that because of a zero-payment claim and another minor claim that I can't verify, the only coverage I could get was going to be twice as much as I had been paying with my previous Liberty Mutual policy . Which I had cancelled, because (I thought) I had the new insurance from Lokey/Allstate! I truly regret that I ever responded to that marketing email from Lokey. Dealing with this has been a nightmare.

resp.text: Im very sorry that you had a bad experience. I will be happy to call you tomorrow to discuss.

I have been mailing Michelle for several months now to let her know that she has been sending me details of someone else’s account. I live and work in Scotland, and have never been a customer of Allstate.

All of these emails have gone unanswered which - having worked in financial services at a senior level myself for over 20 years - astounds me at the level of disdain being taken with a customer’s data.

I hope that this review, which I was asked to provide by Allstate,  will finally prompt some action on Michelle / Allstate’s part so that the Greg Watson they’re trying to contact is no longer having his financial circumstances communicated to some random from the other side of the planet.

Amber is always great and the people in the claims department were also extremely friendly and helpful - Clay and Alexandria

This company knows what it is doing and while I've heard horror stories about every single one of their competitors, I've never heard anything but praise for Farmer's.
Not much more to say. Worth every penny.

resp.text: Thanks, Max! You and your family have been loyal Farmers customers going on 40 years, which may be a record for one of my clients. It's always fun to visit with you and it's always a pleasure to work with you! You have a great family and I know you are proud of them. Tim

I was told that I wouldn't get a full refund even though it's only been one day...that it's prorated and I might get back $20. That all depends on their accounting department. So I asked for that number and was told nobody has it. So basically I wasted $70 dollars and had to find another insurance provider that could do what I needed.

Update...
Due to my post, a member of management tried to reach out to me. At that point, I've talked to several people about the same issue, so I didn't bother responding back out of disappointment and frustration. Surprisingly, I received my refund in the mail. So thank you to whoever it was that had the decency to show compassion especially during these times. Bless you and thank you so much.

name: Joe Bradley
text:
NO STARS!!!!!!
(This system would not allow me to post until I gave it at least one star.)

Very disappointed with Liberty Mutual. I just noticed a $2.00 "Installment Fee" on my bill allowing them to make automatic monthly withdrawals from my account to pay my monthly car insurance bill. When I first signed up for insurance I was told if they had to mail my bill it would be a $2.00 monthly fee and the auto withdrawal from my account would be at no charge. NOW there is a charge. I am sure L.M. saved millions by not mailing out their bills if you consider postage, envelopes, printing costs and labor. Did I see a reduction in my insurance? NO. I called and asked the C.S. Rep about this charge and she said it was only recently initiated and all customers are being charged. She also stated if I wanted a bill mailed it costs $5.00/month. I think this is another example of corporate greed. Having the funds come from my account is not labor intensive, it happens automatically so what is the reason for any charge? I for one and sick and tired of being nickled and dimed for the sake of corporate big whigs wanting a bigger yacht or more expensive car or whatever.  I am in the process of looking for another insurer. I would love suggestions from any of you out there who could steer me in another direction for insurance coverage.

resp.text: Joe Bradley, thank you for letting us know about this. Your feedback helps us get better

name: Tiffany W
text:
By far one of my worst experiences ever!!! The staff are not helpful and they don't know what they are talking about. I could go on forever about this visit but to make it short, I was forced to cancel my home and auto insurance after being a loyal customer for 8 years. Due all to this visit

I'm still contemplating reporting them to the Better Business Bureau or the government agency that looks into insurance unfair practices. I tried filing a complaint with their company but they gave me  the run around and never contacted me back.

There is a lot more to this story and as a black woman I was downgrated into one of the hottest trends that is happening in America. I felt horrible and sad that I gave them so much of my time and money over the years. The customer service center managers were just as bad.
Oh, I forgot I would make this short. Moral of the story, Please Beware!!

name: Tina Williams
text: I bought insurance from them two years ago.  They did not give me a competitive rate, charged me $35 cash for their services, and the owner, Paul Roberts, was very rude, but the other guy in the office was helpful, (although he could do nothing without asking Paul).  I went back to ask for flood insurance after Hurricane Sally (September 2020) because FEMA deemed my property to be in a flood zone.  Waited a month.  Called again and left a message.  Talked to Paul himself this time, who said he'd check and call me back. Waited another month and nothing.  I risked just showing up at their office next. I spoke to the other guy who said he'd tell Paul to call me.  It's now January 2021 and I'm still waiting.  The Insurance agency they set me up with won't deal with me directly.  They have to hear from Paul, and Paul couldn't possibly care less!  So unprofessional!

Christie and Kim are; professional, efficient, and have the best dedication and customer service I have seen.

name: Lorraine Price
text:
They called to offer me a quote on car insurance. I thought, why not? It was half the price of my progressive quote on my latest vehicle. The downside is that it still takes about an hour to sign papers and leave. The upside is that I received quite a few gifts just for signing up. I got a plastic key chain, a magic jar opener (rubber gripper), a tire pressure key fob, chapstick, hand sanitizer, and a  20 oz. stainless steel mug. My agent, Derek, also gave me tips on how to save money on groceries and meat, and movies.
He cared and showed concern for my budget.

resp.text: Lorraine, thank you for taking the time to leave such a positive review and kind words. We are happy to serve you with all of your insurance needs!

name: David Williamson
text:
I've  had State Farm insurance for 50 years.  Never been disappointed.  For the last several years Pam Marbut has been my agent.  I couldn't be any more pleased.  She has been more like a friend.  She looks after the needs of my family very well.  She sold me universal life policies when each of my grandchildren were born,  Two of them are now using money from  those policies to help pay college tuition.  I have car, life and home covered with State Farm.  Pam has shown me all the ways those policies can work best for me. I  have some amazing experiences from working with Pam. Getting close to the end of my life but have no doubt State Farm with take me to the end.  Thanks State Farm and thank you Pam.
David Williamson

name: Brittany Brown
text:
Update time! I've been with Wendy Burpee for I think two years now? Maybe more! Everyone at this branch is a DREAM. They are SO sweet, so willing to go out of their way to save me a dollar on my plan, that I can't imagine switching for life.

As I learned recently, State Farm is a mutual company (no shareholders), which is a different type of insurance than many other companies, and it absolutely shows in the pricing and the customer experience. It's like the credit union version of insurance (I think! I'm still new to the concept). I know not everyone will get the lower price, but if you haven't tried, seriously give these ladies a call.

OLD review: I'll be honest - I haven't met the agent, and I haven't spoken to anyone in the office at length. But to me, this simply speaks of the efficiency this office is working at. If I have an issue, boom, done by the front desk. Taken care of. Five minutes or less. Need to make an extra payment? Need to change your plan? Need anything? Sure, her team gets it done. They seem pretty courteous in the blips of chats we've had, so I assume they must be pretty solid. Best insurance I've had so far.

resp.text: Oh wow. Brittany! You made our day. I am so glad it shows that making it easy for people to do business with us at the best value we can provide is what we are striving to do. We want every interaction to be an experience that brightens your day a little. Thank you so much for taking the time for such a thorough review!

text: Mark and I reviewed a broad range of coverages that I needed. At no time did I get the feeling that he was in a hurry to get to something else. name: D B
text: We are very particular about the Insurance Companies we deal with.  We seek a personable, trustworthy and easily accessible agent when we look for insurance.  We don't deal with calling and being put in a queue waiting for the "next available associate" who will assist you shortly. If we can't talk to the agent or his assistant every time we call, we find another agent or company to deal with.  With that said...Mark Holley, and his assistant Whitney, are easily reached with a visit, a call or a text.  Mark is always ready to help in anyway possible, for a potential claim, a new property to add or just to make a payment.   We are not just a number or policy to Mark or his assistant.  They promptly return calls and most of the time answer immediately.  Personal service is why we stay with Farmers and the Mark Holley Agency.  This is a great agency to be with and we look forward to continuing to have our insurance needs met Mark Holley, his assistant and Farmers.

resp.text: Donna, thank you for the kind words! Communication and prompt service is what we strive for. We appreciate your business, and look forward to continuing to serve you in all your insurance needs! Thanks Again!!

name: Crimson Viceroy
text: Mark was very unresponsive when I first approached him in getting a quote for home insurance.  He would not return any emails or voicemails and when an initial introduction was made, it was very mechanical.  Not to mention, that he had no credible information with which to properly gauge what sort of nominal protection I would need for my home.  I am a first time homeowner and you would think that in the insurance business, most agents would be quite adept at offering some really good information regarding protective countermeasures that your home would benefit in having or some good tips on how to help prevent certain problems with the home.  Sure you could Google the information, but then what would be the use of having a "certified and expert insurance agent" like Holley if he refuses to answer questions.  Overall, I would either find another agent in the Farmer's Insurance community or I would simply keep shopping around.  The beautiful thing about free enterprise capitalism is that you're not necessarily stuck doing business with unprofessional and uncaring folks such as Mr. Holley.

name: James Darby
text: I want to thank Keri Tennant with Trey Poole's State Farm Insurance for all her help during the past few months.  Keri was instrumental in assisting us with our first homeowners claim after having been a State Farm customer for almost forty-five years.  We were in the process of selling our home when Hurricane Zeta damaged our roof and Keri was quick to respond with answers to our many questions.  Keri helped us navigate the claim adjuster process with ease.  After our roof was repaired and we closed the home sale, Keri was able to transfer our homeowners policy to a rental policy for a very brief period of time before we then closed on our new home.  Keri then transferred the renters policy back to a homeowners policy.  Keri handled our paperwork issues without delay and kept us fully informed of our policy status.  Keri even sent us a handwritten card for our thirty-third wedding anniversary which was signed by her as well as Mr. Poole's staff.  Keri has been a blessing to us - Mr. Poole is lucky to have her.  I would highly recommend you to call Keri for any insurance need.  Thank you Keri!!

resp.text: Thank you for your business and review! We appreciate you!

resp.text:
Mr. Newsome,

I apologize if our staff has done anything to make you feel uncomfortable. That is definitely not our goal. While I completely understand the frustration with the state required insurance, we can’t control that either. Also, we do offer a wide variety of products to help people plan for the worst and my staff is trained to make sure our customers are aware of said products. If there is anything that we as an agency, that works for you, can do to improve your experience with us, please do not hesitate to call me. I will be happy to discuss. 334-365-1800

I began to explain to her and tell her my dad and I moved down here from Rochester n.y and Im in the process of getting car insurance here in Alabama and getting a Alabama driver liscense, I am currently with freeway, but I'm trying to find a cheaper policy. The State Farm representative  at the hot dog and chips stand had another representative bring us to  talk to another State Farm representative that could better assist us. I was directed to go speak with the account Manager, Joshua D. Meil and my dad went to talk with another State Farm representative. As I sat down and explained everything to Josh. He began to tell me his expierence he has been through in his own life and not only it help me, but it allowed me to open up about my situation and ask as many questions as I needed to.  Josh is a expert. He knows everything you need to know about state farm. He is a hard worker, great listener,a helper that cares about keeping his members satisfied and at ease. There has been many times  I came to the office because I had a question or needed help and Josh was there to assist me. I am  so grateful I met Josh. D. Meil. Josh helped me get car insurance here in Alabama and get life insurance the same day. Trey Poole if you fire Josh there wouldnt be State Farm. Thank you Joshua D. Meil for everything!!!!

And the woman manager needs to keep her shoes on. So unsanitary!
Oh wait! I know why so many good reviews! Because on day 1 they push that paper in your face about leave a review and get a gift card!

Edit: Photo hopefully attaches. You don't have record of me, but I just received this birthday card thanking me for my prior business? Lol.. Okayyyyy.. That's alright, I'm happy with my new folks. (I see the photo just went into the "photos of" tab, but it gets my point across. You guys are trying to ignore bad business, which by the way does not make business better, it just makes you bad human beings.)

text: My husband and I have life insurance through Alfa and our agent is Gabe Martin.  Any time that we have questions about our policies, he is very quick to respond and willing to advise us on which policies are most appropriate for us. He truly cares about his customers and will do whatever he can to provide exceptional service. There is honestly no one I would feel more comfortable entrusting with our insurance needs.

name: Sandy Love
text:
I've known Gabe for years! The first time I insured anything with him, I bought a car toward the end of the work day on a Friday (I believe) and he agreed to insure! That was in 2007! Since then, I've gotten married and we ended up moving all our insurance to Gabe! He has always been helpful - through 3 totaled vehicles😱! He is dedicated and truly cares about his clients.
For each accident, Gabe made sure I knew each step to take (although unfortunately by the 3rd I was starting to feel like a pro😞). He worked to make sure everything was in order and handled so the claim was paid quickly... Even when we were hit by an uninsured driver. Even though our vehicle insurance was dropped (because of Alfa regulations about total loss - NOT GABE), we have our other insurance with Gabe still - with no plans of changing! He was extremely helpful when we recently bought a home. (*and btw, Gabe made several phone calls with me sitting in his office trying to get the auto insurance reinstated).
Gabe is a hard-working, trustworthy, community-minded man that I would recommend to anyone looking for insurance!

name: John Cole II
text: Best agents in town! Great customer service!

name: Abby Fry
text:
I feel the need to warn people of getting ripped off by a local insurance agent Gabe Martin with Alfa insurance. My husband and I began looking for our home to purchase in August 2017. After we decided on a home and were under contract I contacted Gabe for a quote. My husband and I decided that since we will be moving in a few years it was best to keep our current insurance-- we've never had any issues with them. We closed on our home on Oct 24th 2017. I noticed in November that our homeowners insurance never got paid (the seller paid 1 year at closing). I contacted both my insurance company and our mortgage company. The mortgage company had the incorrect insurance information and the two exchange information. In the meanwhile, Gabe showed up to my home and told my husband that I had contacted him to change insurance companies and had him sign an application--3 weeks AFTER we closed on our home. Now, why would an insurance agent that I contacted be going behind my back and having my husband sign paperwork? My husband trusts what he said and signs the paper, we just wrote it off as just for it was for quotes or something and never thought of it again. A couple of weeks later, I get a letter from our mortgage company stating that we had previously had Alfa insurance and that it was our responsibility to cancel our policy. Now, I never received a single letter from them-- I had no idea what my policy number even was. They had received a check and cashed it WITHOUT ANY KIND OF PERMISSION. I called Veterans United to find out that Gabe took it upon himself to get my PERSONAL loan information from my lender and added Alfa insurance to our loan-- we never signed any kind of paperwork when did this. I called Gabes office-- who could not care less about the issues I was having. The secretaries were VERY disrespectful and nasty. Then Gabe called me and was even worse. He was saying that he had text messages saying I wanted insurance-- which was not true. And said that this was my fault and that I had contacted him and I must have forgotten. I had to take this all the way up to the district manager and it took 2 months and I'm currently waiting on my refund check. Remember how I said the seller paid at closing? Well, that amount was less than what our current insurance is-- and since we've closed there is no way to get the hundreds of dollars difference back from the old seller so we are out this money because of Gabes actions. We never received any kind of apology and they take no responsibility. I would steer clear of Alfa insurance-- especially Gabe Martin.

**** there one only one review of Gabe Martin-- from himself. Since I've given this very honest review magically there are multiple positive reviews. FAKE!

name: Marvin Barnes
text: (Bait and switch) I was quoted a certain rate for homeowners insurance on my rental property. I paid the periumum in full for the year.  Then about 3 months later, I was charged more without explanation. So far, the auto and primary homeowners insurance premiums have been as quoted, but it has only been about 6 months.

resp.text:
Mr. Barnes,
Thank you for your feedback. We do appreciate your business. To address your comment that we did a bait and switch, we simply do not do that. Upon further investigation of your comment, I found out that the property is a duplex. We were never told that it was a duplex when we did the initial quote. Every risk is different in some way, it is vitally important that we know everything and disclose everything or it could cause you a problem in the event of a claim. If you feel that this is an error, please call my office and we will be glad to sit down and review the information. I would appreciate it if you would consider revising your score as this is reflection upon our agency. My family has been associated with Allstate for 55 years and we did not get there by misleading our customers.

name: Dianna Gore
text: HOW DO I FEEL ...... NOT GOOD! My experience IS NOT OVER. AND it appears my claim has been closed! My camper trailer was damaged during Hurricane Sally. It' going to cost close to $5,000.00 to get it totally repaired and the adjuster gave an estimate of $3,700.00??? I have pictures to show the gouge in the side of my camper, it goes all the way through to the inside wall. He thinks the materials will cost $144.00???? It's really going to cost around $550.00!! I've been an Allstate customer for over 50 years .......I AM NOT ONE BIT HAPPY. And on top of that, I've received no phone calls from Pete Russell's office, only emails. After 50 years I would expect a little more from my agent!

name: Anna Bryant
text: These guys do a great job. They are always available and patient! Thank you!!!

name: Andrew Davis
text: My wife was in a bad car accident in the fall of 2017 where she was rear ended while coming to a stop by someone at about 50-55mph. The driver that hit her had the state minimum limit ($25K) and my wife’s medical bills exceeded that amount so we filed an underinsured  motorist claim with Allstate foolishly assuming they would pay the claim since we had the coverage and had been paying for it. It’s now over two years later and we are in court with Allstate because they refused to pay our claim. They have probably spent more in legal bills than the $25K limit we have. We have underinsured motorist coverage for this exact type of issue and our own insurance company is going out of their way to not help their own insured. Add to this, at no time have we gotten a call from our agent to ask if there was anything we needed or to even check on my wife. I would in no way recommend Allstate.

name: Jason Wright
text: WORST INSURANCE EXPERIENCE EVER!!!! GIVING 1 STAR ONLY BECAUSE 0 STARS IS NOT AN OPTION! We were solid paying customers and paid 6 months in advance the entire time we had the policy. My wife and I just merged bank accounts...so we contacted our agent and had the account switched to the merged account since we were planning to close the other one out... Allstate told us it was taken care of. Not True! - So we realized something was wrong when we got a notice (which was the 1st notice we had received) stating that our policy coverage had been terminated because of failure to make payment. We called the agent office and informed them that we had received the notice and apparently the amount of time it takes for the bank account changes to take place didn't kick it into effect until they had already tried to auto draft the payment from the wrong account and therefore instead of calling us to let us know, they just sent us a letter after the policy was terminated. So at this point I called to discuss with an agent on the Friday when we found out to see what could be done  because we were supposed to be going out of town and currently had no insurance coverage... I spoke with a very polite office admin in which I asked her to see if there was anything that could be done.... in which she obliged but she informed us that she would need to call the underwriter and make sure they were going to reinstate the policy, which we didn't think would be an issue because we had not had any accidents/accident claims while we had been under the related policy. So we get a call back about 2 hours later that the underwriter was not going to reinstate the policy because during the term of the coverage, my wife had made a claim to have a cracked windshield replaced in which she asked the agent before making the claim and was told that it would not go against us in regards to our policy or premium because it was part of what was covered under the policy that we were paying for. We asked them to see if there was a manager or agency owner that could do anything to correct the situation but apparently our local office manager was on vacation and the other branch managers that were supposedly contacted either weren't really contacted or didn't care because we were never contacted again and ended up having to find a new insurance coverage through a different agency. This was probably the worst I have ever been treated from a customer service standpoint in consideration that we are always good prompt paying customers and the fact that our bill not getting auto-drafted was attributed to Allstate's screw-up and then we weren't notified until our policy had already been cancelled and then they used the most petty excuse to not re-instate our policy. I would not recommend Allstate to anyone...ever.

name: Wendy Bond
text: In all my years of dealing with insurance I have never had such nice and respectful people as here in this office. I would recommend them to everyone just for the customer service, but to add to it is the much cheaper pricing for our auto insurance. I had previously priced around and finally enrolled with Geico. After some time I started getting calls from Christine in this office, trying to speak with me and give a quote for State Farm. As my busy days moved on the messages remained unreturned, until one afternoon Christine left the price quote in the voicemail. When I heard the amount I took a break at work to return the call and see if it was real. I am definitely glad that I made that call, and I would recommend this office to everyone.

I didn't want to switch auto insurance because I have been with them for 5 years and didn't want to lose all my discounts which they couldn't give me. Hopefully next time they will explain all to a customer before the customer makes the purchase. I would have kept looking other places.

name: Meshia
text:
have been with Direct Auto for a few years now. They have this amazing lady name Katrina Prince, in the Anniston, Alabama location. When I very first signed up, she helped me make sure I was getting the coverage that I needed. Each year, when its time to renew, I call, but each time I encounter someone other than Mrs. Prince, it always ends up a problem, and me about to cancel and go to another company. Then, I end up either asking for or emailing her, who in turns always corrects the problem, and get me signed right on up. So, I have just decided that, I will contact her when its time to renew each year. Each of my friends with Direct also agree. She actually treat you like a close friend or family member. I have never felt rushed or forced to accept something I did not want. I have had cheaper rates offered, but I think the level of care Mrs. Prince shows to the customers keeps us there. I believe if she left, we would also.  I DON'T THINK THEY GET ANY BETTER THAN MRS. KATINA PRINCE. Thank you for everything you do
my "yearly friend."

resp.text: Hi Meshia, Direct Auto thanks you for taking the time to share your review! We appreciate your compliments on behalf of Katrina Prince. Thanks for your business. Have a wonderful day!

name: Brandon Tyler
text: I have had the pleasure of doing business with State Farm and Jenna Mack’s branch for over 5 years now and they never cease to amaze me. I have advertised this particular branch to friends and family because of how well my wife and I are treated with the branch customer service. I have never felt a company or business care so much for their customers the way Jenna Mack’s branch does. I tell Susan, my favorite representative of the Jenna Mack- State Farm branch all the time that the branch would be in a tough position if Susan didn’t work there. I was living near Ozark when I started doing business with State Farm, but since then, I have lived in Birmingham and Dothan, Alabama. Now, my wife is travel nursing and we travel all over the Southeast. My business with Jenna Mack’s State Farm branch continues today, not because it is in a convenient location for me, but because I will never find the same customer service or satisfaction elsewhere. When I began shopping for a new insurance provider, they were the least expensive, but since the day I began my business with them, I have not compared or questioned any of the prices for the policies I have because the customer service cannot compare. I know that I am receiving the best rates and policies the company has to offer because my representative, Susan, keeps me informed and tells me what I need to know. If there was any advice I would give to anyone, it would be to give this branch a chance. The moment you do, you will kick yourself for not having them in your lives sooner. I can’t describe the service and satisfaction to the degree which it deserves. This company and branch in particular will show you the benefits of doing business with them.

I had a car wreck, a dear ran into my car and when I filed my claim they called back and said that it was denied because my license were suspended and I didn't know they were suspended. What's the point in paying for full coverage insurance when the company doesn't want to pay for the damages all because of their mess up. If my car was sitting in my yard and and got hit they would still have to pay for it...right? So I advise you all to stay away from this cheap insurance.

text: I closed in escrow on my house about a month ago,  so I paid almost $1400 up front for my homeowners insurance.  A couple of days ago,  I noticed a pending transaction on my checking account from them. They were pulling the amount out of my account. I called to try and get it handled.  They cannot do anything! So now I have to wait for it to hit my account, get a fee for over draft from my bank, and late fees from all of the other bills that were coming out of that acount that day. I'm supposed to send them bank statements to be refunded. But what do they do before I have the chance. They try to pull it from my account again. And again they can do nothing. My car payment and my credit card payment are coming out of my account today as well.  So looks like I'll have even more late fees. They are an absolute nightmare to work with. Do not trust these people with your bank information.

text: Allstate Insurance Agent Brad Johnson is a one a kind Insurance Agent.  He is very thorough with answering any insurance questions needs. After speaking with Brad, I acknowledged that he had the best interest for me and my family.  I am now an Allstate Insurance client.  YAY!  I have already had to file claims.  Brad and his team have been tremendous with helping me file my insurance claims and getting them processed.  Brad’s knowledge base, welcoming approach, great customer service, professionalism, willingness to execute the best plans for customers is why I highly recommend Brad Johnson and his team to help you with your insurance coverage needs.

name: Bill Clayton
text: I don’t write many reviews but often look at them when deciding on a service or company I am not familiar with. This was the same in this case. We bought a beachhouse in Gulf Shores and our normal insurance company back home wasn’t able to insure the home being so far away. We were recommended to a whitehaven by our realtor for their service and pricing. Honestly the pricing was good but I can not say the same for the service. 9 months ago we had to file a claim for our tile roof that was leaking from a large storm that came through and tore off some of the tiles. 9 months later I’m still trying to get the insurance holder to finish the claim their own adjuster has suggested to fully replace the roof due to the inability to match the tiles. Normally I’d have it fixed myself but no one has been able to find suitable replacements that would even fit. Whitehaven has never once called to check on the claim nor offer any advice nor assistance with getting this completed. So we still have a beautiful beachhouse with a roof that has patchwork to prevent the leaks and reasonable cost insurance that’s absolutely no good. Be careful what insurance you go with ... you just might need it one day. Also be careful who is your insurance broker. Whitehaven is quick to give you a quote and setup the insurance but absolutely no assistance when you really need them. I looked at their reviews before using them initially and wish someone had placed this review so that I would’ve avoided using them to begin with. I sincerely regret having to leave this negative review.

(Original)
MI esposo se vio envuelto en un acidente con uno de sus clientes esto fue el pasado febrero. Y  6 meses despues ellos todavia no le han pagado el auto a mi esposo. Tremendo servicio. Yo fui personalmente a  sus oficinas y eso fue una perdida de tiempo.  Nunca antes visto.

name: victor jolley
text:
So, after 7 years of great service, I no longer want to do business with this agency. They bumped my auto liability to HALF A MILLION DOLLARS back in November. They have dodged, made excuses, etc etc. and still wouldn't take it off. I imagine they will make further excuses after reading this. Tried to cancel policy, but when I call, they put me on hold, then i get hung up on after about 5 min. I put a stop payment on this last bill for the exact amount, which is required to stop the payment. What did they do? After bank stopped the draft, Wiggins agency dropped the amount down, after 6 months of fighting, to original pre half million dollar amount. Then ran it through again! Went through, of course, because it was a diff amount. So now, in addition to being overcharged since November, they have now taken money on insurance I no longer want. I want this money back now, and I want my overcharged money back for the last 6 months!
And I loved these guys. All this because somebody decided to Jack up my policy, then give me the run around on correcting it. SMH.

name: Bonnie Sendejo
text: Michelle Chapin set up my policy and set it up incorrectly. When I responded to an email to inform her of this she ignored me. Then I was charged twice and set up with 2 policies. When I emailed her again directly I was ignored. She finally responded when I sent an email to Craig letting him know my experience with her. I emailed her 3 times asking about a refund and she has yet to respond. I had to call the 800 number to get assistance and was told my over payment was not refunded as I had asked but applied to other policy. The 800 number was able to correct this while I still have be ignored. I would not recommend this office.

resp.text: I understand your concerns and want you to know that we are here to help in any possible way. Please call us at 256-881-1100 or feel free to email me directly at joseph@wigginsagency.com. Thank you so much.

text:
Michelle is AWESOME!   ! just moved to Alabama from Scottsdale, AZ and thought my high insurance rates would be significantly lower, but to my surprise there went up ( I do have 1 accident on my record).  I called  GEICO, a Farmers  association,  an  independent  broker ( who checked many firms including  AAA) and eventually I decided to stay with  Progressive  (which  raised my rates) .

That was until I did a DuckDuckGO search for "Highest Rated Insurance Broker Alabama " .  Michelle's  sweet face popped up with  State Farm.

She has been so responsive even though i know she is busy.   She texts which I really  prefer.  With the same  deductibles on my BMW X5 diesel,  VW JettA diesel and old Jeep  CJ7 she managed to save me over $400.00 every six months.  That's close to $1,000.00 every year!  Real money 💰

That is partly because State Farm has a niche for  older vehicles that can be classified as antiques.  My jeep is being  restored and the classification saved me quite a bit.

I am a combat veteran but USAA has gotten ridiculously  expensive if you aren't married and apparently if you have more than 1 vehicle.   I am so  happy with  State Farm and Michelle.  She was so patient and I  felt like she was a long lost friend and she didn't hurry me at all even though I called her back far after she was closed.

Thank you for a great welcoming and outstanding  rates that blew the competition away!

Even though they don’t know me, they acted like they did and acted like they truly cared about my well being and about getting my life straight again. text: Excellent service by Mr. Shane himself. Great prices compared to other companies.

name: Jeff Jones
text: Shane has been my agent for four years and, despite living nearly 200 miles from his office, I won't even consider another agent or agency. I've bought several vehicles during the past four years which have required numerous changes and updates. Each time I call the office, they treat me like a relative. They always recognize me and are willing and anxious to help. I'm an old man and likely worrisome at times. But, all the associates are  always patient with me. Just today, Caleb went above and beyond to help me without any benefit to himself professionally or monetarily. He did it because they are good people who actually give a darn. If you need insurance, a loan or investment advice, do yourself a favor and call these folks. You can thank me later.

text: Most responsive agent I have ever had - handles claims quickly and professionally. I always receive excellent  customer service.

name: Angie Campbell Hopkins
text:
Dean Pappas has been my parents' insurance agent for more than 40 years. About a year ago, my mom's memory began slipping and I had to take over their finances. Although it took me a little while to get their bills caught up, I never had to worry about one of their policies lapsing because Susan (Dean's assistant) would either call or send me a personal email reminder. She also thoroughly answered all of my questions and was very compassionate and understanding about my parents' situation.
If you call during business hours, either Susan or Sandra actually answer their phone. They don't leave you on hold, transfer you to 10 different "specialists" with broken English who can't resolve your issue after 2 1/2 hours on the phone (it's happened to me several times with AT&T).

name: Stacy Jones
text: It all started when I bought a brand new Nissan Versa in April, only to have it wrecked a week later in a front-end collision by an uninsured driver. It took me more than a month to save a little money and come up with a second down payment to buy another car. Unfortunately due to the fact that I'd had  two fender benders in the last 3 years that I was at fault for, this third accident theoretically gave Allstate the idea that it was okay to raise my rates to triple what they had been. My new car now cost half of what I had to pay for insurance on  it. I struggled through a few months, stealing from Peter to pay Paul just to make the bills each month. And this on a disability check. Then my neighbor said "call Direct Auto, we got great rates"jj. And I did , thank-you  Kidasha, I am no longer paying more for my car insurance than for my car , I'm no longer stealing from Peter to pay Paul every month to pay the bills and I'm finally able to breathe easy knowing that my check is enough to cover all my expesenses. I cannot begin to tell you how much I appreciate all she's done for me.

text: Overall it's a good agent.  However , I had told the Agent that this house is under major renovation. Someone came out and did an inspection. I had it repaired by the date and informed the Agent. I even sent  photos . About a week later I was notified that my policy was cancelled. I had to contact the Agent to get it straightened out. Seems like a lack of communication between the underwriters and the Agent.

name: My Le
text: I and my son need to apply for an ITIN (individual taxpayer identification number) so we came here to get our passports certified, instead of having to send our original ones. Ms. Alejandra Lopez was super helpful and professional. She helped us fill out form W7 and also arrange our tax documents that we prepared by ourselves to send them to IRS. It took less than an hour for two applications, including waiting time, so it was quite prompt. We were very pleased with their service

resp.text: We appreciate your review. Thanks for using our services.

name: cartresa stewart
text: Manny was awesome! Very informative. I recommend everyone to come see him..

resp.text:
Hello Cartresa,
We are so happy that you had a fantastic experience!  Please know that we appreciate you very much!

name: Abby Santillan
text: Two days before the tax deadline, Alex tackled our taxes for us without any hesitation whatsoever even though she was up to her neck in clients! She was so incredibly professional, accommodating, helpful, and patient. I honestly don’t know what we would’ve done without her. She deserves a paid vacation and a big fat raise!

resp.text: Thanks Abby for your comments and using our service. Alex does a great job! We love having her with us!

name: Sherrie Campbell
text: The visit was a pleasant one. Went with my mom to get wind coverage for her home. The person who waited on us was nice and pleasant. The only thing that gave me cause for pause was the fact that the coverage for items in the home was only covered at 50% of that for the structure as opposed to the 75% that every other company offered. This concerned me. She even asked me/us was that enough. I mentioned that the coverage from Allstate was a greater % based on structural coverage. However, no greater coverage was offered. Otherwise, all went well. As you can see, I've still not come to terms with the 50%, but we paid for the year in full. It's a done deal now... she was nice, but the coverage isn't ideal...

name: Margaret H
text:
After years of handling insurance on everything from boats to.vehicles, offices, homes, jewelry and anything in between - we have worked with several insurance companies and many agents. After working with Stephen Moore at the Michael O'Neal State Farm Agency we can honestly say we have never before had the top class service Stephen provided! Attentive, knowledgeable, efficient, concerned, innovative are just a few of the words we'd use to describe Stephen's approach to meeting our needs. And we saved money in addition to getting better coverage!

We also realized after working with Stephen that our homeowners policy had not been adequate - and after increasing our coverage we STILL saved money! That is almost unheard of in any industry today and reflects not only on the quality of State Farm's products - but to the personal attention of their agents. We would recommend contacting Stephen Moore for quotes on any of your insurance needs!  You'll never find a better agency than Michael O'Neal - and you'll never find a better agent than Stephen Moore!

Please know that your business is greatly appreciated, and we will be here for your and your family whenever you need us!  Blessings!

name: Toni{JuneBug} Evans-Henderson
text: Michael O'Neal has been my Mom's insurance agent for as long as I can remember.My Mom and I both have both had the pleasure of dealing with Renee at the office,she is always very sweet and goes out of her way to help answer questions for us.If I had to rate State Farm Insurance as a whole I wouldn't give 5stars but since this is Michael's office I believe they deserve it.As far as State Farm I wouldn't recommend them to anyone being that my Mom had Car and Homeowners insurance with them for approximately 35years,always paying faithfully.She had also recommended myself and several other family members and friends but when she lost her home of 35 years to a fire they dropped her after paying the claim which in my eyes isn't what anyone is looking for when looking for Home or Car insurance.People pay insurance so if they have to deal with a tragedy like we did,their insurance company has their back through the unimaginable time as well as after.State Farm would rather drop clients than be there for them which of course cost more to the devoted clients who pay their insurance praying they never have to use it but knowing it's there if they have to.

name: ALESHIA L. HUDGINS
text: I’ve used this company before and always go into this location to pay, let me start off by saying Ms.Phylis and Mr. LaQuinton has always been super helpful.  Today 7/28/2020 at around 1:00pm I went in to make a payment and Carl Johnson had a customer and he was rude to the gentleman who was in making a payment also; when it was my turn I went up and advised him I need to make a payment. I also wanted to know why the amount was 100 instead of 80.. I advised Mr. Johnson I just called over the phone, and it had just advised me that it was 80 he rudely replied “ because it ain’t got your reinstatement stuff on it that’s 20 dollars” . He proceeded to huff and puff due to me asking him a question so I then asked what was on my policy he ignored my question and went on to say “your policy ends this month and you just now asking what’s on your policy?” I then advised him it changed from 40 to 60 and needed to know why because I need something very basic... Mr. Johnson then stated LaQuinton messed up my policy by removing features that’s needed and doesn’t know why he did it because I have to have roadside asst. I advised I didn’t need or want it I have it through my phone company he then said I can’t remove it so you gotta pay it. The tone and approach was definitely off with him and I advised him it’s a way to say everything being rude to loyal customers isn’t the way I advised him I come up there every month and have never had any problems with anyone being rude until now and I will be seeking other places to get coverage at. I made the payment that definitely wasn’t a issue I just had questions about my policy but him being rude and nice nasty just did it for me I won’t be renewing in August.. Thank you LaQuinton and Phyllis for making my previous visits welcoming and smooth I appreciate you!!!!

text: BEFORE YOU GET ACCEPTANCE INSURANCE BEWARE IF YOU WRECK WHILE GLANCING AT YOUR PHONE OR TALKING ON YOUR PHONE YOUR CAR WILL NOT BE COVERED. MAKE SURE YOU READ YOUR POLICY CAREFULLY. THE GUY BRYAN SCOTT THAT SOLD HER THE INSURANCE WAS TO FOCUSED ON CHATTING WITH THE GUY AT TALLASSEE AUTOMOTIVE TO FULLY EXPLAIN THE POLICY TO HER . SHE HAD TO CONSTANTLY CALL HIM SO THAT  HE COULD SEND THE EMAIL WITH INSTRUCTIONS STATING WHAT PICTURES HE NEEDED HER TO TAKE. MY OPINION THE SECTION IN THE POLICY ABOUT PHONES SHOULD BE ON THE VERY FRONT PAGE IN BOLD. IF I WAS THE AGENT THAT WOULD OF BEEN THE FIRST THING I DISCUSSED. I GUESS ITS MORE IMPORTANT TO MAKE A SELL THAN EXPLAIN THE COVERAGE

I'm busy with a life, too. But after waiting all day and the next day with no return call, I figured I'd just call customer relations. They couldn't even tell me why she gave me a binder with one price and I receive a bill with another price. So, CR put me in contact with this agency.  The little witch AT THE AGENCY (I can't remember her name) who was supposed to be helping me, HUNG UP IN MY FACE!!  I refuse to pay AND beg someone, too. I have been with State Farm before and never have I felt like a second hand citizen like I have by this agency these past couple of days. The competition in the insurance business is too great for anyone to take my money and mistreat me. Just signed up with another insurance company TODAY!!

name: Doug
text:
BEWARE******BEWARE******BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
WE HAVE NEVER BEEN SO INSULTED!
WE HAD 5 AUTOMOBILES AND HOMEOWNERS INSURANCE WITH
REBEKAH BROWN STATE FARM. OVER THE YEARS WE HAD 2 VERY
SMALL AUTO CLAIMS. OUR POLICIES WERE UP FOR RENEWAL AND
"WE WERE CANCELED" NO OPTION TO RENEW JUST DUMPED ON!
THE WHOLE REASON FOR INSURANCE IS FOR PEACE OF MIND AND
TO BE PROTECTED IN TIME OF NEED! WE HAVE BEEN VICTIMIZED BY
THE VERY ONE WE THOUGHT WOULD PROTECT US? ONCE CANCELLED
WHEN SHOPPING AROUND HAS MADE OUR PREMIUMS TRIPLE! AFTER
DAYS OF RESEARCH WE DID HAVE A COMPANY BEAT THE RATES WE
HAD WITH STATE FARM! OF COURSE THEY WANTED TO KEEP OUR
HOMEOWNER POLICY "REALLY" ! WE WERE TOLD BY THE GIRLS IN THE
OFFICE THEY DON'T UNDERSTAND WHY WE ARE BEING CANCELLED?
THEY ARE NICE BUT HAVE NO SAY SO WHEN STATE FARM CANCELS YOU! THEY HAVE CREATED STRESS BEYOND MEASURE TO MY FAMILY!
PLEASE DON'T LET THIS HAPPEN TO YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Erin Defelippo
text: I was happy at first. Don't get me wrong. First I was dealing with a girl that we will call C. She was sweet. She helped me start up my policy and because I was alone on this, I was new to everything. She assured me that everything would be okay and that things would work out and they did.....for a while. My bill fluctuated so much and at one point they managed to withdraw from my account twice with in a three month range and overdraft my bank account, see C knew I wouldn't have the funds for this stuff until a certain date and I was told by another rep at this office that  my stuff couldn't be withdrawn from my account on the day that I wanted. It had to be there way. I never saw, spoke to, or emailed with the representative in this office "Rebekah brown" instead I was shuffled over to another agent we will call her L. L took care of most of my stuff and because I didn't want the automatic withdraw she decided that it was OKAY for me to call in and make my payments. On the last day dealing with this particular office, I dealt with another agent and by then I had enough. I told this agent "I do not want to speak to you do not call me back, I do not wish to deal with you, I am not going over anything with you." and this was because SHE wanted to change everything in my policy or do this and do that and this and that. All I wanted to know was WHY I was being charged 100$ more than what I was being charged the first go around. Now because of this office I AM WORKING with another agent and trying to UNWIND all the mess that was created by this office. It has been an absolute disaster. Here I am 3 months out from this agency and the new Agent is STILL cleaning up the mess created. Heck, at least I know who I am dealing with because they actually interface with their people, don't switch their people from agent to agent, and actually RETURN phone calls when they say they're going to call back. - Moral of the story - You want a faceless Rep? Go to this agency. Want someone who messes up the policy's and manages to make you pay for it all in one fell swoop? This is the one for you!

name: T Lewis
text: I thought Mrs. Carter was a good agent. I actually switched from Otto Brewer's office to her's because I THOUGHT she was a good agent. State Farm as a whole has been nothing but a nightmare since I began dealing with them. I just started my policy this year with them. The 1st month, I made my payment over the phone with the 1st office. I asked the secretary then if this payment would be automatically debited from my account each month so that I wouldn't have to worry about that payment. The 2nd month rolls around and I get an email and a statement in the mail about late payment and policy cancellation. I quickly call the office and ask why. The secretary explains that she never got my authorization to draft my account, so they didn't. So, I make the payment, and voila! same thing the next month! So they assure me they will get it right, but I say no, I will just call in each month and make my payment. Low and behold, THEY DRAFT MY ACCOUNT!! I had just paid the premium 2 weeks prior because of all the confusion, so twice in one month I paid them! Oh no, I only allot one payment a month for you all! So I request a refund and to switch to a new office. Instead of them just reversing the payment, they cut a check and I have to wait 7 days to get my money back! This really fires me up, but I remain a loyal customer to them and go to Tyna Carter's office! And she does me the SAME DARN WAY! I call and ask why did they draft my account when they were UNAUTHORIZED TO DO SO! Sadie answers the phone and is so very rude! I say hi Sadie...no response..."This is T....Lewis"....still no response. So I tell her my issue and she STILL DOESN'T SAY A WORD! I have to say hello after 2-3 minutes of silence. She then says, "Umm, you didn't authorize us to take this payment huh?" Sounding sarcastic and then says hold on. Mrs. Carter comes to the phone and tells me that I did sign an authorization for them. I say no ma'am I didn't, as a matter of fact, I told Raven, Sadie and the guy from the customer service line that I DID NOT WANT STATE FARM BACK IN MY BANK ACCOUNT! I told Sadie when she took my payment that I did not want them in my account because I had previously had issues with them doing that correctly. Mrs. Carter kept going back and forth with me until she saw the error, which was the info had just been transferred into the system and not changed when I asked them to upon changing to their office. She says that she could issue a refund that wasn't a problem, because AGAIN I HAVE PAID THEM TWICE IN ONE MONTH, but she NEVER ISSUED THE REFUND! In fact, the transaction is no longer pending in my account, they have taken it and not tried to reverse it. My guess is the hag cut me a check once again! I AM DONE WITH THIS SCREW UP OF A COMPANY!!!!

text:
Complete waste of time, called to get a quote at 2:30pm on 5/21 and agent says he will contact me no later than 10am the next day and no call back received so I call around lunch time receptionist says he's out to lunch so I finally get a call back around 3pm telling me they can't beat my current rate because one of their software programs they use is showing I had 2 accidents on my record which was untrue because I've never had a wreck in my life.

I call my current insurance provider who I was insured with at the time of these supposid accidents and guess what? They don't have a record of them either and neither does my local DMV.

The agent was really nice but my god if your using software that gives you obvious incorrect information and your using that information to provide potential customers quotes..i would suggest investing into an alternative.

resp.text: Hello Greg, we are truly sorry to hear about your struggle concerning your auto quote. Insurance can be complicated enough, and we recognize the frustration of an undesirable outcome. We strive to provide the highest quality of service in every interaction with our customers and take any discontent very seriously. Our CEO has reached out and left his personal contact information in order to rectify this situation. We hope to hear back from you.

text:
Nobody is ever there. Trevor will not answer his phone, and Patrick is ALWAYS out to lunch or unavailable. Smooth talker though, but smooth talking will only get you so far. Will be switching policies somewhere else only because I am sick and tired of not being called back. No, I do not want to talk to your secretary. I want to talk to Trevor. Since my business is obviously not important I will take it somewhere else. I cannot keep taking personal time out of my day and not have anything to show for it.

1/10

name: none
text: I have tried to cancel my policy for little over a month now and they are still charging me even though they was notified that the vehicle was not even running and was even charged more than what my policy was normally this last time by almost 40 dollars very unprofessional and unorganized now I'm going to have to fight to get this refund and have already been told I wont get it all back so there just stealing my money because they didn't do what they was supposed to over a month ago

resp.text: Justin I'm sorry there is confusion on how the billing works. You had an auto payment set up and did not notify the company in time that you would like to suspend your payment. Due to the non pay and the following months coverage you received you were charged for that amount. Any time you cancel the policy you will be pro rated based on time not used which State Farm will always honor. They do not automatically take off coverage when your vehicle is no longer running as it's still required by law to have insurance on any registered vehicles. I wish you the best going forward and we are happy to help clarify any further confusion you may have concerning your bill.

name: David ‘Hoss’ Cowart
text: Jenna was very helpful and took care of everything.

name: Cunby Stevenson
text: Trevor Butcher team will lie to you, and tell you whatever they need to get you information, so they can charge you the 1st month, never mind what their underwriter says. you'll get cancelled after they take your money.

resp.text: Cunby we are always honest and truthful in our business practices. The reason the policy was cancelled by the underwriting department had to do with a DUI that was on the record and because we were not given the proper driver license number we did not come across this during our initial writing of the policy. I am sorry for any inconvienence this may have caused you as our primary goal is to run a business with high integrity and we do our very best to create a great experience for anyone that interacts with us. The money that was taken was applied for the coverage that you received and was prorated for any time that was not used. I know we have spoken about this several times and I am sorry that you were unhappy with the results.

name: Adam Karsten
text:
I have always used Geico and Progressive for my automotive insurance needs, but recently I was contacted by an agent from this office named Matthew Tompkins. I have never utilized State Farm before, and did some research and found great experiences from numerous people.

I was immediately blown away by the quick and consistent responses from Matthew. He made me feel like I was his only customer, and it was refreshing getting to deal with a local agent rather than the remote 800 number services I was accustomed to.

I had them do a quote, and was greatly surprised at the amount of coverages I could get for home and auto.  Pricing was very competitive, and I was able to obtain extraordinary coverages, along with umbrella, and discovered they can provide coverages for my business as well.

Thus far, I've had a great experience and would encourage others to consider using this office for your insurance needs if you're in Baldwin County. This group seems to truly care about taking care of you and getting you set up with what you want for a reasonable price.

Highly recommended!

Just fyi for any insurance company out there who may see this. I understand that a business has the right to refuse service to anyone for any reason, but they did not even have the decency to tell me why they wouldn't work on it, so I don't keep running into the same problem when I find a decent mechanic.  It is sad when you treat long time, paying customers this way.  Also, heads up, this is not a Better Business Bureau Accredited business. So folks may want to check and make sure they are licensed and bonded.

text: I am not personally still a client. After the 2011 tornadoes and us not having a claim at all, our premiums went up dramatically. So, I chose State Farm. My family member was in the hospital for a couple of months. ALFA refuses to pay no more than $5000 for our family member's medical bills. What is the purpose of paying premiums for well over 25 years, only for it to be absolutely misleading when it actually came to a claim being filed. I highly suggest doing research before going with ALFA. AND you have to pay $135 annual fee JUST to be a member? No thanks. My mom's car she bought to replace her totaled one was quoted at DOUBLE what the same policy State Farm quoted. So, needless to say, she's with State Farm now.

text:
Jason Gardner-State Farm is conveniently located near Regions Field and the UAB campus. The staff is very kind,friendly, and professional.
The agents are very knowledgeable about auto insurance, homeowner's insurance,  renter's insurance, and life insurance.
Service is always very quick--they'll get you in and out and won't have you waiting on the phone a long time like some other places. They go above and beyond to make sure they'll get you the best rate they possibly can to help save you money.

resp.text: Thank you so much for this great review. We truly appreciate the feedback! -Jason

text: Kay at State Farm made me feel very  comfortable with it being my first time seeking life insurance.She  was very relatable and she took her time with me while answering  every question and addressing my concerns. My interaction with Kay brought about much trust in State Farm. I definitely recommend this agent she is certainly the BEST !

resp.text: Khierra that warms my heart. Life insurance is one of the most important things that one can do to take care of the people they care about most. We like to call it “love insurance”! Therefore , we want to make sure that our clients make the best decision possible at that time. Answering questions to make the choice easier is why we are here. You should never buy something you don’t understand. Welcome aboard! #heretoserve

text: Ms. Angelica  helped me get everything squared away for the benefit of my life. She did it in such a timely manner and she was so nice and helpful! She explained everything to me and answered all my questions and concerns. Thank you so much!

name: David Till
text:
State Farm has handled my insurance since I graduated college, and I have had as many as seven cars, a house, and my life under policy wth them at once. In this stage of life, my wife and I have downsized, and I had only two cars and a renter's policy in GA, and two cars in TN belonging to a son and daughter at UTK when I called Ken Davis's office.

Angelica answered and was very personable, prompt, competent, and professional in helping me to move one car's insurance from TN to AL and add another renter's policy for a son that has recently left Knoxville, TN, and UTK, to become a "rocket-head" in Huntsville. She set it up for the bill to hit a State Farm credit card monthly. I appreciate her making this easy, as little about being a parent is, even after they are grown!

Thank you, Ken Davis; and specifically, many thanks to Angelica!!

resp.text: David, glad we were able to make life a bit easier for you. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. I’ll let Angelica know you gave her nice marks on her report card. We are always here to serve.

text: I am pleased with the service that I received from this agency as I needed to establish insurance in the area. The office staff was receptive to my need and made recommendations accordingly. This is one of the best agencies I have interacted with in my 26 years as a State Farm client.

name: Jeremiah
text: I purchased a new Kia  and spoke with Angelica to set up full coverage. When the paperwork arrived she had only signed me up for liability.  They corrected it when I reached out, but it made me a little uneasy.  I don't know how you get from a conversation that was clearly about full coverage for a car that was purchased with a car loan to a liability policy.  They also had another driver on  my policy listed as my spouse even though I told them very clearly I am not married.  State Farm is good insurance, but this agent seems careless with details that could seriously affect your policy and claims.

resp.text:
Jeremiah,

We would like to apologize for your negative experience at our agency. We’d like to learn more about your specific situation and make things right. If you wouldn’t mind giving us a call at 256-489-5450 at your earliest convenience, it would be greatly appreciated.

Went there a second time to re-cancel and make sure they stop taking money of my account and now they just text me my payment its due in 5 days. I dare them to go ahead a take another payment of my account. Refund?! Sit, wait and pray. Don't recommend this company!

text: Unresponsive to customers, ended up costing me more money for my insurance so now i have to waste more time finding someone new.

We are also very sorry that we can not advise you of what another insurance agencies policies and processes are .   However, when we have a customer that is changing insurance we advise our clients of that information.  It is recommended that you contact the other carrier and discuss why they did not inform you of their discount procedures.  We are happy to help you in the future if you decide to bring your other insurance products to us :-)

name: Art Mann
text: After being a State Farm customer for 30 years, I changed agents due to the previous person retiring. I called to discuss being cancelled for filing too many claims. She insisted on an appointment, claiming she could fix the problem. I arrived at the appointed time. When I got there, Candi was interacting with someone on a social level who had a new baby and pretty much ignored my presence. Eventually, the secretary said Candi had an appointment elsewhere and she left the building. She referred me to some guy who was brand new at the insurance business and only wanted to talk about being a star college football player. I eventually left after wasting around 30 minutes of time, even though Candi was the one who asked me to stop by in the first place. I was already doubtful she could do anything about the situation and I was eventually proven correct. Since then, I have had nothing to do with Candi or State Farm insurance and never intend to do so again. There are lots of State Farm agents in the area. My advice is to steer clear of anyone who would invite you to their business at a specific time and then spend that time playing with someone else's baby.

Initially, Nacobi contacted me and provided quotes for auto and rental insurance. Nacobi is a very pleasant agent. I have since corresponded with other agents representing the Cantrell agency. Erica is also a very responsive, patient and knowledgeable agent. Thank you for helping with our insurance needs. We use the Drive Safe & Save app.
*my parents have had insurance with State Farm in another AL city for as far back as I can remember :)

resp.text: Thank you for the great review.   We appreciate you!

name: Liam Scott
text: Had an extremely helpful call with Nacobi Upton! She was polite and engaged and helped move things along as swiftly as possible.

resp.text: Thanks Liam!  We’re here to help.

name: stephen douglas
text:
State Farm is the product which we know is a good solid insurance company and has been for many years.  But the outstanding quality to me is the great customer service I've experienced with this agency and in particular agent Mallory Hale.
Mallory called me for over a year and a half checking with me to see if I was interested in switching from my previous insurance company.  She never pressured me to switch, was always respectful, and I always looked forward to hearing from her. Well due to her persistence we were finally able to work out a switch from my former company to State Farm. The time was right as I was able to save several hundred dollars for the same coverage. But had it not been for Mallory's continued  persistence in securing  my business it never would have happened.
I spent 22 years as General Manager for the worlds number 1 hotel company and I have worked with great customer service people and Mallory ranks with the best that I have ever been associated with. I have not had a lot of contact with the other professionals in the office yet but if they are all like Mallory, Scott Cantrell had done a great job of hiring.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Stephen.  We appreciate you.

name: Regina Miles
text: Autumn Owens was the Representative that helped me with my Auto and Renter's insurance. She was Amazing I felt like I was talking with an Old Friend. Professional yet Cordial, Knowledgeable, Patient , Kind just Outstanding Customer service. My Overall experience is we need more Autumns in the World.

resp.text: That’s awesome to hear Regina.  We appreciate you!

Thank ya'll for being professional, courteous and knowledgable! Very impressed!!!

name: Jessica Bailey
text: Shady, shady people. I would not recommend doing business with this location in particular. My policy was canceled and when I asked why they said that I verbally agreed to do it. When I tried to reinstate my policy the price jumped up nearly 400$. There is also a problem with the way they listed numerous people on a policy,  long story short I have a wreck on my record that me nor any vehicle I owned had any part of. Please,  stay away from this location. Would recommend old church insurance or geico. These people have thrown a good bit of shade in the past 12 months.

name: Adam Reid
text: Over the past 18 months State Farm has increased my rates each time during the 6 month notification period.  The rate increase happened 3 times every six months.  I did not have any claims until the snow event in February 2014.  So that may explain one rate increase but doesn't explain the other rate increases over the other two times.  I checked with other auto insurance companies and Progressive offered a better rate so I decided to change.

name: jimmy youngblood
text:
Would prefer not to complain on here but I could not find another forum to do so. I’ve used AAA on and off for 20+ years. I’ve always had good service. I initiated a roadside assistance call in Vestavia at approximately 1:50 CST. The original estimated time of arrival was 2:20, then that changed to 3:45 then 4:05. Its 4:15 and still no one has shown up. Someone did finally call and say they were on the way. By the time they get here it’s going to be close to 3 hours before someone shows up. It’s going to be hard for me to pull the trigger to renew my membership if this is the kind of service I should expect going forward.
Update: 4:38 CST- still sitting here waiting

name: David Ferrell
text: Very slow responses, could be much better

name: Shenequa Burks
text: Insurance is awful, I had an accident and because my car was at fault they didn't hesitate to total out my car because it was new. It took forever to get a response and when I did it was again a run around came. I cancelled my insurance policy because I found a cheaper and better quote, so I called in 08/2019 to cancel the insurance along with road side assistance. Now date all the way to 01/03/2020 $162.00 was taken out my account for road side assistance that was supposed to be cancelled in 08/2019. Let's not forget I was quoted a price of $95 dollars on a two year basic because of all the cars on the policy. I called them on the 01/3/2020 and 01/7/2020 and I'm getting the run around again I just want my money put back in my account for a membership that was cancelled last year. It takes them no time to reach in and get the money but takes 7-10 BUSINESS DAYS to give it back. Highly upset I would not recommend them to anybody.....

name: Casey Benefield
text:
Policy is what it is. Got rear ended, and it took 5 days to get a claim number. I did try to get the claim office on the phone immediately at the scene, via the 24/7 "call and report immediately" number on the back of my insurance card.

I have the audio on my dashcam for that where I kept trying, and they gave  me the runaround. Everyone I have talked to locally about this seem to not understand why, and honestly I have no idea why either. Once I got to my local branch, we got a claim number. Easy peasy. Apparently I'm the only person who has ever been told "we're just roadside."

I just hope... that now that I have someone's email and direct number, that we can get through this....

Now, on a previous claim, they had NO issue doing a claim when it was something against me.

I also wanted to ask a simple question, but unfortunately, the person answering the phone acted like a full-stop barrier. They kept on focusing on a different claim, and would not even let me speak about this one.... that I FINALLY got started/a claim number for.

I had to waste more time, drive down there to the office, to ask my question. My question had a short simple answer when I got there. It didn't have to be that complicated.

Vicki (sp?) always treated me right (within AAA's policy at least), but as a whole, AAA's insurance product just plain stinks compared to other policies I had in the past. Vicki is why I give AAA 2 stars instead of 1. I think she was trying her best.

State Farm, who I came from, even though they accused me of false odometer every year (I work from home), they at least gave me a claim number when I called, and they ultimately covered things in the end, like glass, which AAA doesn't cover at all.  I keep learning of things with AAA that are not covered, or just under-insured...

The ultimate irony is, the Missouri AAA was sitting there accusing me of the false odometer thing too... the very reason why I left State Farm. I even ended up going down to the Acton Rd office to drag someone out to the car, so they can look  for themselves. On a modern car, you can't fake the odometer reading like you can on an older car... this is a 2017.

Seems like every time I need AAA for something, even if it is simply to update phone numbers, it's unnecessarily difficult.

Trust is important, and I need to be able to trust that my insurance company will handle things without argument, in the policy, and that the policy is sufficient for incidents like this current one.

I'm frustrated, stressed out, and didn't need all that added on to the fact that a potentially uninsured motorist just rear ended me....

name: Christy Phillips
text:
Previous experiences working with insurance companies have left me overwhelmed, frustrated, and confused.  Each time, I’ve started the process hoping for the peace of mind that I would be able to put in place the protection & resources necessary to not only protect my assets, but also provide my family with financial security if & when life doesn’t go according to plan.

While I doubted this time would be any different, I went ahead & agreed to work with Mr. Avant to determine if my current insurance policies were the right options for my specific circumstances, & to verify the rates were competitive.

To my surprise & delight, Trae Avant was able to save me hundreds of dollars on property insurance & took the time to effectively communicate the details of each policy option by giving me real life scenarios that I could relate to.

Trae Avant is an authority on insurance.  His extensive knowledge on all the policy options available & the fact he represents one of the most financially stable insurers in the country – State Farm – gives me the confidence that I can trust him to advise me on the best solutions for my family’s current & future needs.

I would highly recommend giving Trae Avant a call if you are looking for a seamless experience & a strategic partner to navigate you through the process of protecting your most important assets.

text: Zac is not your typical insurance agent. He goes the extra mile to be sure you have the right amount of coverage for your situation at an affordable price.
